bill_title: revise, under certain circumstances, the vote required to allow a public body to issue bonds.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise, under certain circumstances, the vote required to allow a public body to issue bonds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 6-8B-2 be amended to read as follows: 6-8B-2. Unless otherwise provided, no bonds may be issued either for general or special purposes by any public body unless at an election a favorable vote is calculated in the following manner: (1) If less than fifty percent of the eligible voters of the public body vote on the question, sixty percent of voters of the public body voting upon the question vote in favor of issuing the bonds; or (2) If fifty percent or more of the eligible voters of the public body vote on the question, fifty percent of voters of the public body voting upon the question vote in favor of issuing the bonds. The election shall be held in the manner described by law for other elections of the public body. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
